channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Georgia advances ‘foreign agents’ bill as 20,000 rally against it
item.description: The ruling party suddenly reintroduced the bill earlier this month, after mass protests forced its withdrawal last year.

item.title: India election 2024 phase 1: Who votes and what’s at stake?
item.description: A total of 102 constituencies in 21 states will vote on April 19 for the first phase of the Lok Sabha elections.

item.title: NPR editor resigns after accusing US outlet of liberal bias
item.description: Uri Berliner quits broadcaster days after being suspended over essay accusing network of lacking viewpoint diversity.

item.title: More than 11,000 evacuated in northern Indonesia as volcano erupts
item.description: Exclusion zone extended, flights disrupted as Ruang sends ash and smoke more than two kilometres into the sky.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 784
item.description: As the war enters its 784th day, these are the main developments.

item.title: Columbia University leaders face scrutiny over anti-Semitism on campus
item.description: Columbia President Nemat Shafik sought to avoid the outrage that erupted after a previous congressional hearing.

item.title: Police make multiple arrests in ‘largest gold theft in Canadian history’
item.description: Police say five suspects arrested, three more being sought over theft of 6,600 gold bars at Toronto airport last year.

item.title: Why is Pakistan expelling Afghan refugees?
item.description: Afghanistan says the move is illegal, but Pakistan insists it's for security reasons.

item.title: Ruling HDZ party wins most seats, but no majority in Croatia election
item.description: The country is likely to face a period of uncertainty as HDZ negotiates with smaller parties to form a government.

item.title: Hezbollah launches missiles and drones at northern Israel
item.description: At least 14 Israeli soldiers are wounded in an attack launched from Lebanon as regional tensions escalate.

item.title: Palestinian Prisoners’ Day marked amid growing number of detentions
item.description: Local monitoring groups say the number of Palestinians imprisoned by Israel has doubled to at least 9,500 since the war

item.title: Woman, seeking loan, wheels corpse into Brazilian bank
item.description: A woman wheeled the corpse of an elderly man into a bank in Brazil, hoping to get a sign-off on a loan.

item.title: Biden urges Congress to end impasse and send aid to Israel and Ukraine
item.description: US president's appeal comes as House Speaker Mike Johnson unveils plans to bring funding bills for a vote.

item.title: After the Hurricane
item.description: The effect the carbon footprint of rich countries is having on developing nations who enjoy very few of the benefits.

item.title: Brazil football legend Romario announces comeback at 58
item.description: Many will recall Romario's starring role at the 1994 World Cup, but he's registered to play again in Brazilian football.

item.title: Is China growing tired of Russia’s war in Ukraine?
item.description: There are signs that Beijing may be getting cold feet about its deepening entanglement.

item.title: Russian peacekeepers start withdrawal from Azerbaijan’s Nagorno-Karabakh
item.description: Soldiers begin to leave region in South Caucasus long fought over by Azerbaijan and Armenia.

item.title: World’s coral reefs face global bleaching crisis
item.description: A mass bleaching event caused by high ocean temperatures is threatening the survival of coral reefs around the world.

item.title: James to headline another US ‘Dream Team’ at the Paris 2024 Olympics
item.description: Thirty-nine-year-old LeBron James will team up with a host of other top NBA players to go for gold at the Paris games.

item.title: Photos: Iran shows military might as tensions with Israel soar
item.description: Iran holds military parade days after its missile and drone attack on Israel.

item.title: Palestinian Prisoner’s Day: How many are still in Israeli detention?
item.description: Why are nearly 10,000 Palestinians being held in Israeli prisons - one-third of them without charge?

item.title: UK set to ban tobacco sales for a ‘smoke-free’ generation. Will it work?
item.description: The UK's smoking ban aims to phase out sales of tobacco, which is one of the main causes of cancer deaths in Britain.

item.title: Pakistan says it blocked social media platform X over ‘national security’
item.description: The platform remained inaccessible to users but government officials refused to acknowledge any restrictions, until now.

item.title: The thousands of Palestinians Israel arrests, tortures, holds even in death
item.description: As Palestinians mark Prisoner's Day, Israel continues to hold and mistreat thousands of Palestinian captives.

item.title: Qatar ‘re-evaluating’ role as mediator in Israel-Gaza truce talks
item.description: Qatar’s prime minister says there has been 'abuse and harm' done related to Doha’s mediation efforts.
